To clarify, the IAS perspective is one in which an individual attributes their own behavior, physical or mental characteristics, or outcomes to internal factors, such as their own abilities, personality, or intentions. In contrast, external attribution style (EAS) would attribute these factors to external factors beyond one's control.

So, please go ahead and share the event, and I'll do my best to create an IAS post based on it!
